TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit CCTMXTiledMap extends Cocos2D.CCNode

Docs.summary: <para> <see cref="T:Cocos2D.CCTMXTiledMap" /> knows how to parse and render a TMX map. </para><see cref="T:Cocos2D.CCTMXTiledMap" />
Docs.remarks: <para>It adds support for the TMX tiled map format used by <ulink url="http://www.mapeditor.org">http://www.mapeditor.org</ulink> It supports isometric, hexagonal and orthogonal tiles. It also supports object groups, objects, and properties.</para><ulink url="http://www.mapeditor.org">http://www.mapeditor.org</ulink><para>Features:<list type="bullet"><item><description>Each tile will be treated as an Sprite</description></item><item><description>The sprites are created on demand. They will be created only when you call "layer->tileAt(position)"</description></item><item><description>Each tile can be rotated / moved / scaled / tinted / "opaqued", since each tile is a Sprite</description></item><item><description>Tiles can be added/removed in runtime</description></item><item><description>The z-order of the tiles can be modified in runtime</description></item><item><description>Each tile has an anchorPoint of (0,0)</description></item><item><description>The anchorPoint of the TMXTileMap is (0,0)</description></item><item><description>The TMX layers will be added as a child</description></item><item><description>The TMX layers will be aliased by default</description></item><item><description>The tileset image will be loaded using the TextureCache</description></item><item><description>Each tile will have a unique tag</description></item><item><description>Each tile will have a unique z value. top-left: z=1, bottom-right: z=max z</description></item><item><description>Each object group will be treated as an MutableArray</description></item><item><description>Object class which will contain all the properties in a dictionary</description></item><item><description>Properties can be assigned to the Map, Layer, Object Group, and Object</description></item></list></para><list type="bullet"> <item> <description>Each tile will be treated as an Sprite</description> </item> <item> <description>The sprites are created on demand. They will be created only when you call "layer->tileAt(position)"</description> </item> <item> <description>Each tile can be rotated / moved / scaled / tinted / "opaqued", since each tile is a Sprite</description> </item> <item> <description>Tiles can be added/removed in runtime</description> </item> <item> <description>The z-order of the tiles can be modified in runtime</description> </item> <item> <description>Each tile has an anchorPoint of (0,0)</description> </item> <item> <description>The anchorPoint of the TMXTileMap is (0,0)</description> </item> <item> <description>The TMX layers will be added as a child</description> </item> <item> <description>The TMX layers will be aliased by default</description> </item> <item> <description>The tileset image will be loaded using the TextureCache</description> </item> <item> <description>Each tile will have a unique tag</description> </item> <item> <description>Each tile will have a unique z value. top-left: z=1, bottom-right: z=max z</description> </item> <item> <description>Each object group will be treated as an MutableArray</description> </item> <item> <description>Object class which will contain all the properties in a dictionary</description> </item> <item> <description>Properties can be assigned to the Map, Layer, Object Group, and Object</description> </item> </list><para>Each tile will be treated as an <see cref="T:Cocos2D.CCSprite" /></para><see cref="T:Cocos2D.CCSprite" /><para>The sprites are created on demand. They will be created only when you call "layer->tileAt(position)"</para><para>Each tile can be rotated / moved / scaled / tinted / "opaqued", since each tile is a <see cref="T:Cocos2D.CCSprite" /></para><see cref="T:Cocos2D.CCSprite" /><para>Tiles can be added/removed in runtime</para><para>The z-order of the tiles can be modified in runtime</para><para>Each tile has an anchorPoint of (0,0)</para><para>The anchorPoint of the TMXTileMap is (0,0)</para><para>The TMX layers will be added as a child</para><para>The TMX layers will be aliased by default</para><para>The tileset image will be loaded using the <see cref="T:Cocos2D.CCTextureCache" /></para><see cref="T:Cocos2D.CCTextureCache" /><para>Each tile will have a unique tag</para><para>Each tile will have a unique z value. top-left: z=1, bottom-right: z=max z</para><para>Each object group will be treated as an MutableArray</para><para>Object class which will contain all the properties in a dictionary</para><para>Properties can be assigned to the Map, <see cref="T:Cocos2D.CCLayer" />, Object Group, and Object</para><see cref="T:Cocos2D.CCLayer" /><para>Limitations:<list type="bullet"><item><description>It only supports one tileset per layer.</description></item><item><description>Embedded images are not supported</description></item><item><description>It only supports the XML format (the JSON format is not supported)</description></item></list></para><list type="bullet"> <item> <description>It only supports one tileset per layer.</description> </item> <item> <description>Embedded images are not supported</description> </item> <item> <description>It only supports the XML format (the JSON format is not supported)</description> </item> </list><para>It only supports one tileset per layer.</para><para>Embedded images are not supported</para><para>It only supports the XML format (the JSON format is not supported)</para><para>Technical description: Each layer is created using an <see cref="T:Cocos2D.CCTMXLayer" /> (subclass of <see cref="T:Cocos2D.CCSpriteBatchNode" />). If you have 5 layers, then 5 <see cref="T:Cocos2D.CCTMXLayer" /> will be created, unless the layer visibility is off. In that case, the layer won't be created at all. You can obtain the layers (<see cref="T:Cocos2D.CCTMXLayer" /> objects) at runtime by:<list type="bullet"><item><description>map->getChildByTag(tag_number); // 0=1st layer, 1=2nd layer, 2=3rd layer, etc...</description></item><item><description>map->layerNamed(name_of_the_layer);</description></item></list></para><see cref="T:Cocos2D.CCTMXLayer" /><see cref="T:Cocos2D.CCSpriteBatchNode" /><see cref="T:Cocos2D.CCTMXLayer" /><see cref="T:Cocos2D.CCTMXLayer" /><list type="bullet"> <item> <description>map->getChildByTag(tag_number); // 0=1st layer, 1=2nd layer, 2=3rd layer, etc...</description> </item> <item> <description>map->layerNamed(name_of_the_layer);</description> </item> </list><para>map->getChildByTag(tag_number); // 0=1st layer, 1=2nd layer, 2=3rd layer, etc...</para><para>map->layerNamed(name_of_the_layer);</para><para>Each object group is created using a <see cref="T:Cocos2D.CCTMXObjectGroup" /> which is a subclass of MutableArray. You can obtain the object groups at runtime by:<list type="bullet"><item><description>map->objectGroupNamed(name_of_the_object_group);</description></item></list></para><see cref="T:Cocos2D.CCTMXObjectGroup" /><list type="bullet"> <item> <description>map->objectGroupNamed(name_of_the_object_group);</description> </item> </list><para>map->objectGroupNamed(name_of_the_object_group);</para><para>Each object is a TMXObject.</para><para>Each property is stored as a key-value pair in an MutableDictionary. You can obtain the properties at runtime by:</para><para>map->propertyNamed(name_of_the_property); layer->propertyNamed(name_of_the_property); objectGroup->propertyNamed(name_of_the_property); object->propertyNamed(name_of_the_property);</para><para> <para>v0.8.1 </para> </para><para>v0.8.1 </para><para>v0.8.1 </para>
